page.title: 03Mattingley Area - History.
page.content: An old bottle-kiln can be seen at the {disused Hazeley Bottom Brickworks. The{C.15th Mattingley Church}with its timber-frame is reputed to be built from bricks burnt on Hazeley Heath as are many local cottages. There are many half-timbered (some thatched) cottages & some attractive farm buil- dings & granaries.{Historic buildings include Dipley Mill, The Dutch House, Hartley Grange, Hazeley House & 'The Leather Bottle' Public House but the best known is the{National Trust {property 'West Green House'.}Also of interest are the C.18th{West Green {Causeway}built by General Hawley to link West Green House to The Dutch House; the{Old Drove Road}near Damales Farm, which once went from Reading to Odiham Fair &{Bluehouse}Farm, formerly the{brewhouse}for the Leather Bottle, hence 'Bottle Lane' which links them.
